info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 12 at 11:51PM MDT until June 13 at 2:00AM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN HAND AND NORTHEASTERN BUFFALO COUNTIES... At 1251 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 8 miles southeast of Pleasant Valley Country Church, or 25 miles south of Miller, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Rosehill Dam. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW! This cluster of thunderstorms is capable of producing tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
